directions: 1️⃣ Peel the banana and cut it into small chunks.
2️⃣ Rinse the spinach leaves thoroughly under cold water.
3️⃣ Add the banana, spinach, almond milk, and chia seeds into a blender.
4️⃣ Blend on high speed for about 30–45 seconds until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
5️⃣ Add ice cubes and blend again for 10 seconds if you prefer it colder.
6️⃣ Pour into a tall glass and enjoy immediately for a boost of energy and natural sweetness.

ingredients: a few drops of lemon juice
optional: chili flakes or sesame seeds
directions: 1️⃣ Toast the slice of bread until golden and crisp.
2️⃣ Scoop out the avocado into a small bowl.
3️⃣ Add lemon juice, sea salt, and a bit of pepper, then mash with a fork until creamy but still chunky.
4️⃣ Spread the avocado mixture evenly over the toast.
5️⃣ Sprinkle optional chili flakes or sesame seeds for extra flavor.
6️⃣ Serve immediately with a drizzle of olive oil if desired.

ingredients: a handful of berries for garnish
directions: 1️⃣ In a medium bowl, pour the coconut milk.
2️⃣ Add chia seeds and vanilla extract.
3️⃣ Whisk thoroughly for about 1 minute to prevent lumps.
4️⃣ Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 4 hours (or overnight) until it thickens.
5️⃣ Stir again before serving to mix evenly.
6️⃣ Top with fresh berries or unsweetened coconut flakes for a light tropical flavor.
1️⃣ Wash zucchinis and trim the ends.
2️⃣ Use a spiralizer or julienne peeler to make noodles.
3️⃣ In a blender, combine basil, pine nuts, garlic, olive oil, and salt to create pesto.
4️⃣ Heat a nonstick pan over low heat, add zucchini noodles, and sauté for 2–3 minutes.
5️⃣ Pour pesto over the noodles and toss until evenly coated.
6️⃣ Serve immediately topped with extra basil or nuts.
1️⃣ Take a clean glass jar or small bowl.
2️⃣ Add a layer of Greek yogurt at the bottom.
3️⃣ Sprinkle oats evenly on top of the yogurt.
4️⃣ Add a layer of blueberries and top with crushed almonds.
5️⃣ Repeat the layers if desired and serve chilled.
6️⃣ Perfect for a quick breakfast or healthy snack.
1️⃣ Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk until smooth.
2️⃣ Heat olive oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat.
3️⃣ Add spinach and sauté for 1–2 minutes until wilted.
4️⃣ Pour eggs into the pan and gently stir with a spatula.
5️⃣ Cook slowly, stirring constantly, until the eggs are soft and slightly creamy.
6️⃣ Season with salt and pepper, then serve immediately.
1️⃣ Wash and cut the cauliflower into small florets.
2️⃣ Pulse the florets in a food processor until they resemble rice grains. Do not over-blend.
3️⃣ Heat olive oil in a large nonstick pan over medium heat.
4️⃣ Add chicken slices and cook for 4–5 minutes until lightly golden.
5️⃣ Add broccoli and carrots, and stir-fry for another 3 minutes.
6️⃣ Add the cauliflower rice and pour soy sauce on top. Stir well for 3–4 minutes.
7️⃣ Serve warm, topped with sesame seeds or a drizzle of olive oil if desired.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a deep pot over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add chopped onions and garlic, and sauté until fragrant (about 2 minutes).
3️⃣ Add carrots, cumin, and paprika. Stir for 1 minute to toast the spices.
4️⃣ Add lentils and vegetable broth, then bring to a boil.
5️⃣ Lower the heat, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes until lentils are soft.
6️⃣ Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
7️⃣ Serve hot with fresh parsley or lemon juice for a refreshing twist.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a skillet and cook the chicken breast 4–5 minutes per side until golden.
2️⃣ Let it rest for 2 minutes, then slice thinly.
3️⃣ In a large bowl, combine diced tomato, avocado cubes, and lime juice.
4️⃣ Add the sliced chicken and toss gently.
5️⃣ Season with sea salt, black pepper, and garnish with coriander.
6️⃣ Serve fresh immediately for a high-protein, low-sugar lunch.
1️⃣ In a mixing bowl, whisk eggs until light and fluffy.
2️⃣ Add almond flour and baking powder, then pour in almond milk gradually.
3️⃣ Stir until a smooth batter forms (not too thick, not too liquid).
4️⃣ Heat coconut oil in a nonstick pan over medium-low heat.
5️⃣ Pour small portions of batter to form pancakes.
6️⃣ Cook for 2–3 minutes on one side until bubbles form, then flip and cook 1–2 minutes more.
7️⃣ Serve warm with a few berries or a drizzle of natural peanut butter (optional).
1️⃣ Rinse quinoa thoroughly under cold water to remove bitterness.
2️⃣ In a saucepan, combine quinoa with 2 cups of water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes until water is absorbed.
3️⃣ Let quinoa cool for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
4️⃣ Meanwhile, dice cucumber, slice tomatoes and onion, and chop parsley.
5️⃣ In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa with vegetables.
6️⃣ Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over the top, mix gently.
7️⃣ Add feta cheese if not vegan, sprinkle parsley and serve chilled or room temperature.
1️⃣ Pat tofu dry and cut into 2 cm cubes.
2️⃣ Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3️⃣ Add tofu cubes and sauté until golden brown on all sides (about 5 minutes).
4️⃣ Remove tofu and set aside.
5️⃣ In the same pan, add ginger, garlic, broccoli, and bell pepper; stir-fry 3 minutes.
6️⃣ Return tofu to the pan, pour soy sauce, and toss to coat evenly.
7️⃣ Serve hot, sprinkled with sesame seeds if desired.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C / 350 °F.
2️⃣ Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
3️⃣ Place salmon fillets skin-side down on the tray.
4️⃣ Brush with olive oil, sprinkle dill, salt, and pepper, then drizzle lemon juice.
5️⃣ Bake 12–15 minutes until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
6️⃣ Serve hot with steamed vegetables or a salad.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a deep skillet over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add onions and garlic; cook until translucent (about 3 minutes).
3️⃣ Add curry powder and toast 30 seconds until fragrant.
4️⃣ Stir in chickpeas and coconut milk.
5️⃣ Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes until thickened.
6️⃣ Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with brown rice or quinoa.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add minced garlic and sauté 30 seconds until fragrant.
3️⃣ Place chicken breasts in the pan and sear each side 4–5 minutes until golden.
4️⃣ Add lemon juice, reduce heat, and cover.
5️⃣ Let cook 10 minutes until chicken is tender and fully cooked.
6️⃣ Sprinkle parsley on top before serving for a fresh finish.
1️⃣ In a blender, combine banana, oats, eggs, and cinnamon.
2️⃣ Blend until smooth and creamy.
3️⃣ Heat coconut oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat.
4️⃣ Pour small rounds of batter; cook 2 minutes until bubbles form.
5️⃣ Flip carefully and cook another 1–2 minutes until golden.
6️⃣ Serve warm with sliced fruit or natural yogurt (no sugar).
1️⃣ In a bowl, mash avocado lightly with a fork.
2️⃣ Add tuna and mix gently until combined.
3️⃣ Add diced tomato, olive oil, and lime juice.
4️⃣ Season with salt and pepper.
5️⃣ Mix once more and serve immediately on lettuce leaves or toast.
1️⃣ Beat eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper.
2️⃣ Heat olive oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat.
3️⃣ Add onions and bell pepper; sauté 2–3 minutes.
4️⃣ Pour in beaten eggs and tilt pan to spread evenly.
5️⃣ Cook until set at the edges, then fold and cook 1 minute more.
6️⃣ Serve warm with herbs on top.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C / 400 °F.
2️⃣ Peel sweet potatoes and cut into thin sticks.
3️⃣ In a bowl, toss fries with olive oil, paprika, and salt until evenly coated.
4️⃣ Spread in a single layer on parchment-lined baking tray.
5️⃣ Bake 25 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and crisp.
6️⃣ Serve warm with yogurt dip or guacamole.
1️⃣ Pour almond milk into a small pot and warm over low heat.
2️⃣ Add turmeric, black pepper, and cinnamon.
3️⃣ Stir constantly for 5 minutes, avoiding boiling.
4️⃣ Once hot and fragrant, pour into a cup.
5️⃣ Drink warm before bed to reduce inflammation and improve sleep.
1️⃣ Cook quinoa following package instructions (about 15 minutes).
2️⃣ While it cooks, grill the chicken breast for 4–5 minutes on each side until golden.
3️⃣ Steam the broccoli until just tender but still bright green.
4️⃣ Slice avocado into thin slices.
5️⃣ Assemble the bowl: quinoa at the base, chicken, broccoli, and avocado on top.
6️⃣ Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice, then sprinkle with pepper to taste.
7️⃣ Serve warm or chilled as a post-workout meal.
1️⃣ Slice cucumber thinly and add to a jug.
2️⃣ Add mint leaves and ice cubes.
3️⃣ Pour cold water and let infuse 10 minutes.
4️⃣ Stir and serve chilled.
5️⃣ Refreshing and hydrating—ideal during sugar detox to replace soft drinks.
1️⃣ Grate zucchini and squeeze excess water with a towel.
2️⃣ In a bowl, mix zucchini, egg, oat flour, and garlic.
3️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
4️⃣ Spoon small portions of mixture into the pan, flatten slightly.
5️⃣ Cook 3 minutes per side until golden and crisp.
6️⃣ Serve warm with a spoon of Greek yogurt or avocado dip.
1️⃣ Combine all ingredients in a food processor.
2️⃣ Blend until smooth and creamy (1–2 minutes).
3️⃣ Add 1 tbsp water if texture is too thick.
4️⃣ Season with salt and adjust lemon juice to taste.
5️⃣ Serve as a dip with veggie sticks or on toast.

ingredients: 100g lean minced beef or lentils (vegan option)
directions: 1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Cut the top off each pepper and remove seeds.
3️⃣ In a bowl, mix rice, beef (or lentils), tomato, olive oil, and oregano.
4️⃣ Stuff each pepper with the mixture and place in a baking dish.
5️⃣ Bake 25 minutes until peppers are tender and filling is golden.
6️⃣ Serve warm with a drizzle of olive oil.
1️⃣ In a jar, combine oats, almond milk, banana, and cinnamon.
2️⃣ Stir well and cover with a lid.
3️⃣ Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.
4️⃣ In the morning, stir again and top with berries before eating.
5️⃣ Perfect for busy mornings—no sugar crash guaranteed.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add garlic and cook until slightly golden.
3️⃣ Add shrimp and sprinkle paprika on top.
4️⃣ Sauté 3–4 minutes until shrimp turn pink.
5️⃣ Garnish with parsley and serve immediately with lemon wedges.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C.
2️⃣ Grate cauliflower, microwave 5 minutes, then squeeze out moisture.
3️⃣ Mix cauliflower, egg, mozzarella, oregano, and salt in a bowl.
4️⃣ Spread mixture onto parchment paper forming a thin circle.
5️⃣ Bake 20 minutes until golden, then add healthy toppings (tomatoes, spinach, etc.).
6️⃣ Bake another 5 minutes before serving.
1️⃣ Combine cucumber, tomato, onion, and olives in a bowl.
2️⃣ Add olive oil and oregano, then mix gently.
3️⃣ Add feta cheese cubes on top.
4️⃣ Serve immediately as a fresh and balanced meal.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add onion and cook until translucent.
3️⃣ Add diced potato and cook for 5 minutes.
4️⃣ Add broth and spinach leaves.
5️⃣ Simmer 10 minutes until soft.
6️⃣ Blend until smooth and serve warm.
1️⃣ Combine all ingredients in a food processor.
2️⃣ Blend until smooth and creamy (1–2 minutes).
3️⃣ Add 1 tbsp water if texture is too thick.
4️⃣ Season with salt and adjust lemon juice to taste.
5️⃣ Serve as a dip with veggie sticks or on toast.
1️⃣ Mix all nuts in a bowl.
2️⃣ Add a pinch of sea salt if desired.
3️⃣ Store in an airtight container.
4️⃣ Perfect for a quick protein boost between meals.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
3️⃣ Add mushrooms and cook until golden (5 minutes).
4️⃣ Add spinach and cook until wilted.
5️⃣ Beat eggs with salt, pepper, and parmesan.
6️⃣ Pour eggs over vegetables, cook 2 minutes, then bake 10 minutes until set.
7️⃣ Serve warm with fresh herbs.
1️⃣ Combine black beans, corn, tomato, and onion in a bowl.
2️⃣ Add lime juice and mix gently.
3️⃣ Top with diced avocado and fresh cilantro.
4️⃣ Serve immediately as a fresh, protein-rich meal.
1️⃣ Preheat grill or pan to medium-high heat.
2️⃣ Season chicken with salt and pepper.
3️⃣ Grill chicken 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
4️⃣ Toss asparagus with olive oil and grill 5 minutes until tender.
5️⃣ Drizzle lemon juice over everything before serving.
1️⃣ Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
2️⃣ Massage kale with olive oil until tender.
3️⃣ Combine quinoa, kale, and tomatoes in a bowl.
4️⃣ Top with pumpkin seeds and drizzle lemon juice.
5️⃣ Mix well and serve immediately.
1️⃣ Thread turkey and vegetables onto skewers alternately.
2️⃣ Brush with olive oil and sprinkle oregano.
3️⃣ Grill or broil 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally.
4️⃣ Serve hot with a side salad.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add onion and cook until soft (3 minutes).
3️⃣ Add broccoli and broth, bring to a boil.
4️⃣ Simmer 15 minutes until broccoli is tender.
5️⃣ Blend until smooth, then stir in cheese.
6️⃣ Season with salt and pepper, serve hot.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
3️⃣ Add shrimp and cook 3-4 minutes until pink.
4️⃣ Add zucchini noodles and cook 2 minutes until tender.
5️⃣ Toss with basil, season, and serve immediately.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C.
2️⃣ Toss all vegetables with olive oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
3️⃣ Spread on a baking sheet in a single layer.
4️⃣ Roast 25 minutes until tender and golden.
5️⃣ Serve warm as a side or main dish.
1️⃣ Combine tuna and white beans in a bowl.
2️⃣ Add red onion and mix gently.
3️⃣ Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
4️⃣ Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell pepper, carrots)
directions: 1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add vegetables and stir-fry 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add curry paste and cook 1 minute.
4️⃣ Pour in coconut milk and simmer 10 minutes.
5️⃣ Garnish with basil and serve hot.
1️⃣ Heat sesame oil in a wok over high heat.
2️⃣ Add beef and cook 3-4 minutes until browned.
3️⃣ Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds.
4️⃣ Add broccoli and stir-fry 4 minutes.
5️⃣ Pour soy sauce, toss, and serve hot.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add onion and cook until soft.
3️⃣ Add rice and toast 2 minutes.
4️⃣ Add broth gradually, stirring constantly.
5️⃣ Add pumpkin and cook 20 minutes until creamy.
6️⃣ Garnish with sage and serve hot.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C.
2️⃣ Brush eggplant slices with olive oil.
3️⃣ Bake 20 minutes until tender.
4️⃣ Layer with sauce and cheese.
5️⃣ Bake 10 more minutes until bubbly.
6️⃣ Garnish with basil and serve.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Place cod on a baking sheet.
3️⃣ Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
4️⃣ Sprinkle dill, salt, and pepper.
5️⃣ Bake 12 minutes until flaky.
6️⃣ Serve with steamed vegetables.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C.
2️⃣ Toss sweet potato with olive oil and cumin.
3️⃣ Roast 20 minutes until tender.
4️⃣ Combine with black beans in a bowl.
5️⃣ Top with avocado and cilantro.
6️⃣ Serve warm.
1️⃣ Thread chicken and vegetables onto skewers.
2️⃣ Brush with olive oil and season.
3️⃣ Grill 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally.
4️⃣ Serve hot with a side salad.
1️⃣ Combine cabbage and carrot in a bowl.
2️⃣ Mix olive oil and vinegar together.
3️⃣ Toss vegetables with dressing.
4️⃣ Season with salt and pepper.
5️⃣ Serve immediately or chill before serving.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add onion and mushrooms, cook 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add rice and toast 2 minutes.
4️⃣ Add broth gradually, stirring constantly.
5️⃣ Cook 20 minutes until creamy.
6️⃣ Garnish with thyme and serve.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Season pork with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
3️⃣ Heat olive oil in an oven-safe pan.
4️⃣ Sear pork 2 minutes per side.
5️⃣ Add apple slices and bake 15 minutes.
6️⃣ Rest 5 minutes before slicing.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add onion and carrots, cook 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add lentils, broth, and cumin.
4️⃣ Bring to a boil, then simmer 25 minutes.
5️⃣ Season and serve hot.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Place cod in a baking dish.
3️⃣ Add tomatoes, garlic, and olive oil.
4️⃣ Bake 18 minutes until fish is flaky.
5️⃣ Garnish with basil and serve.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Cut a pocket in each chicken breast.
3️⃣ Stuff with spinach and feta.
4️⃣ Season and brush with olive oil.
5️⃣ Bake 25 minutes until cooked through.
6️⃣ Rest 5 minutes before serving.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C.
2️⃣ Cut cauliflower into 1-inch steaks.
3️⃣ Brush with olive oil and season.
4️⃣ Roast 25 minutes until golden.
5️⃣ Garnish with parsley and serve.
1️⃣ Mix turkey, zucchini, egg, and seasonings.
2️⃣ Form into 12 meatballs.
3️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pan.
4️⃣ Cook meatballs 15-20 minutes until golden.
5️⃣ Serve with marinara sauce.
1️⃣ Combine cucumber and radishes in a bowl.
2️⃣ Mix vinegar and sesame oil.
3️⃣ Toss vegetables with dressing.
4️⃣ Garnish with mint and serve.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Place salmon and asparagus on a baking sheet.
3️⃣ Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
4️⃣ Season and bake 15 minutes.
5️⃣ Serve immediately.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add curry powder and toast 30 seconds.
3️⃣ Add chickpeas and coconut milk.
4️⃣ Simmer 15 minutes, then add spinach.
5️⃣ Cook 5 more minutes, garnish with cilantro.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Layer zucchini and tomatoes in a baking dish.
3️⃣ Drizzle with olive oil and season.
4️⃣ Bake 30 minutes until tender.
5️⃣ Serve warm.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a skillet over high heat.
2️⃣ Add beef and cook 5 minutes until browned.
3️⃣ Add mushrooms and onion, cook 8 minutes.
4️⃣ Season with thyme, salt, and pepper.
5️⃣ Serve hot.
1️⃣ Roast peppers until charred, then peel.
2️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot, add onion.
3️⃣ Add peppers and broth, simmer 20 minutes.
4️⃣ Blend until smooth.
5️⃣ Garnish with basil and serve.
1️⃣ Heat sesame oil in a wok over high heat.
2️⃣ Add chicken and cook 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add vegetables and stir-fry 4 minutes.
4️⃣ Pour soy sauce and toss.
5️⃣ Serve hot.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot.
2️⃣ Add onion and carrots, cook 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add lentils, broth, and cumin.
4️⃣ Simmer 25 minutes until tender.
5️⃣ Season and serve hot.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180 °C.
2️⃣ Layer eggplant and tomatoes in a dish.
3️⃣ Drizzle with olive oil and season.
4️⃣ Bake 30 minutes until tender.
5️⃣ Serve warm.
1️⃣ Heat grill or pan to medium-high.
2️⃣ Grill halloumi 3 minutes per side.
3️⃣ Grill vegetables 5 minutes until tender.
4️⃣ Serve together with fresh mint.
5️⃣ Drizzle with olive oil before serving.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a skillet.
2️⃣ Add sausage and cook 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add onion and cabbage, cook 10 minutes.
4️⃣ Season and serve hot.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot.
2️⃣ Add vegetables and cook 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add quinoa and broth, bring to a boil.
4️⃣ Simmer 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
5️⃣ Fluff with a fork and garnish with parsley.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C.
2️⃣ Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil.
3️⃣ Place chicken and sprouts on a baking sheet.
4️⃣ Season and bake 35 minutes.
5️⃣ Serve hot.
1️⃣ Toast bread until golden.
2️⃣ Combine tomatoes, basil, garlic, and olive oil.
3️⃣ Season with salt and pepper.
4️⃣ Top bread with mixture.
5️⃣ Serve immediately.
1️⃣ Heat olive oil in a pot.
2️⃣ Add leeks and cook 5 minutes.
3️⃣ Add mushrooms and cook 5 minutes.
4️⃣ Add broth and simmer 15 minutes.
5️⃣ Blend until smooth, garnish with thyme.
1️⃣ Heat grill to medium-high.
2️⃣ Brush mushrooms with olive oil.
3️⃣ Season with garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
4️⃣ Grill 5 minutes per side.
5️⃣ Serve as a main or side dish.
1️⃣ Thread lamb and vegetables onto skewers.
2️⃣ Brush with olive oil and season.
3️⃣ Grill 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally.
4️⃣ Serve hot with a side salad.
1️⃣ Preheat oven to 200 °C.
2️⃣ Roast squash 25 minutes until tender.
3️⃣ Heat olive oil, add onion, cook 5 minutes.
4️⃣ Add squash and broth, simmer 10 minutes.
5️⃣ Blend until smooth, garnish with sage.

recipe_name: Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies No Brown Sugar
ingredients: 1/4 cup monk fruit sweetener or raw honey
directions: 1️⃣ Start by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C) and lining a large baking sheet with parchment paper to prevent sticking.
2️⃣ In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the dry ingredients: almond flour, baking soda, and sea salt until no clumps remain.
3️⃣ In a separate larger bowl, cream together the softened coconut oil and monk fruit sweetener (or honey). Use a whisk or electric mixer until the mixture is light and well combined.
4️⃣ Add the egg and vanilla extract to the wet ingredients and beat until the mixture is completely smooth.
5️⃣ Gradually pour the dry flour mixture into the wet ingredients, stirring with a spatula until a thick dough forms. The almond flour should be fully hydrated.
6️⃣ Gently fold in the sugar-free chocolate chips by hand so they are evenly distributed throughout the dough.
7️⃣ Place the bowl of dough in the refrigerator for about 10 minutes. This helps the coconut oil firm up, resulting in a chewier cookie that doesn't spread too much.
8️⃣ Use a cookie scoop or tablespoon to form small balls of dough. Place them on the prepared baking sheet, leaving about 2 inches of space between each.
9️⃣ Gently press down on each ball with your palm to flatten them slightly (almond flour cookies don't spread as much as wheat cookies).
🔟 Bake for 10–12 minutes until the edges are lightly golden. Let them cool on the baking sheet for at least 15 minutes to firm up before moving them to a wire rack.

ingredients: 1/2 cup grass-fed butter or refined coconut oil
1/3 cup erythritol or powdered monk fruit
1 tablespoon flax meal mixed with 3 tablespoons warm water
directions: 1️⃣ Prepare your 'flax egg' first: Mix 1 tbsp of flax meal with 3 tbsp of warm water in a small ramekin. Let it sit for at least 5-7 minutes until it becomes thick and gelatinous.
2️⃣ Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and prepare a flat baking surface with parchment paper.
3️⃣ In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and the sweetener together using a hand mixer. It should be pale and fluffy to ensure a light cookie texture.
4️⃣ Add the flax egg and the almond extract to the butter mixture and beat until well incorporated.
5️⃣ In a separate bowl, whisk the oat flour, baking powder, and salt. Ensure there are no lumps in the oat flour for a smooth dough.
6️⃣ Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet mixture. Use a spatula to press the dough together until it forms a cohesive, non-sticky ball.
7️⃣ Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill it in the fridge for about 15 minutes. This makes it much easier to handle without using extra flour.
8️⃣ Roll the dough out to about 1/4 inch thickness on a lightly floured surface or between two sheets of parchment paper.
9️⃣ Use your favorite cookie cutters to cut into shapes. Gently transfer the shapes to the baking sheet.
🔟 Bake for 8–10 minutes. The cookies should look set but not brown. Let them cool completely on the sheet; they are fragile while warm but firm up perfectly as they cool.

ingredients: 1 large egg (or substitute with 1/4 cup applesauce)
1.5 cups whole grain flour or almond flour
directions: 1️⃣ Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a standard 9x5 inch loaf pan thoroughly with coconut oil.
2️⃣ Peel the bananas and place them in a large mixing bowl. Use a fork or a potato masher to mash them until they reach a liquid-like consistency with very few lumps.
3️⃣ Add the melted (but not hot) coconut oil to the banana mash and stir well. Then whisk in the egg and vanilla extract until the mixture is uniform.
4️⃣ Sprinkle the baking soda, cinnamon, and salt directly over the wet mixture and stir it in. This ensures even distribution without needing a third bowl.
5️⃣ Gently fold in the flour using a spatula. Do not overmix; stop as soon as you see no more dry flour streaks to keep the bread light and moist.
6️⃣ If using walnuts, fold them in now with two or three gentle turns of the spatula.
7️⃣ Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with your spatula.
8️⃣ Bake for 50–60 minutes. To check for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center; it should come out clean or with just a few moist crumbs.
9️⃣ Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack. Cooling completely before slicing is essential for the best texture.

ingredients: 6 oz tomato paste (look for 'no salt added' if possible)
5-10 drops of liquid stevia (optional, to taste)
directions: 1️⃣ In a small stainless steel saucepan, whisk together the tomato paste and water until a smooth, thick sauce base forms.
2️⃣ Add the apple cider vinegar, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and cloves. Whisk vigorously to ensure all spices are evenly incorporated.
3️⃣ Place the saucepan over medium-low heat. Bring the mixture to a very gentle simmer (watch for splattering!).
4️⃣ Once simmering, turn the heat down to low. Let the ketchup cook uncovered for 10–15 minutes. This allows the vinegar to mellow and the flavors to deepen.
5️⃣ Taste the ketchup. If you find it too tart, add a few drops of liquid stevia one at a time until the balance is perfect.
6️⃣ Remove from heat and let the ketchup cool completely at room temperature.
7️⃣ Transfer the cooled ketchup to a clean glass jar or a squeeze bottle. It will thicken further as it chills in the refrigerator.
8️⃣ Store in the fridge for up to 3 weeks. Use it exactly like store-bought ketchup without any of the hidden acne triggers.

ingredients: 1 cup tomato sauce (unseasoned, no sugar added)
1 teaspoon cayenne pepper (reduce for less heat)
directions: 1️⃣ Combine the tomato sauce and apple cider vinegar in a medium saucepan and whisk together over medium heat.
2️⃣ Add the liquid smoke and mustard, stirring until the mixture is uniform and smooth.
3️⃣ Whisk in the smoked paprika, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. The smoked paprika is key for that 'charcoal' flavor without the actual grill.
4️⃣ Bring the sauce to a slow boil, then immediately reduce the heat to the lowest setting.
5️⃣ Simmer the sauce for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent the bottom from scorching. The sauce should reduce slightly and become very thick and glossy.
6️⃣ For a sweeter profile without the insulin spike, you can add 1 tablespoon of molasses (low GI) or a sugar-free maple substitute, but it's delicious and savory without it.
7️⃣ Let the sauce cool before transferring to a storage container. It's best used as a glaze for meats or a dipping sauce for roasted vegetables.
8️⃣ Keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks. The flavors will actually intensify after the first 24 hours.

ingredients: 4 large organic apples (Gala, Fuji, Honeycrisp work best)
directions: 1️⃣ Peel, core, and chop the apples into uniform 1-inch cubes. Keeping the size consistent ensures they all soften at the same rate.
2️⃣ Place the apple chunks in a medium heavy-bottomed pot. Add the water, lemon juice, and a tiny pinch of salt.
3️⃣ Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat. As soon as it boils, reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.
4️⃣ Simmer for about 20–25 minutes. You'll know they are ready when the apple pieces are tender enough to be crushed with the back of a wooden spoon.
5️⃣ Remove the pot from the heat. Stir in the ground cinnamon until the sauce takes on a warm brown hue.
6️⃣ FOR CHUNKY SAUCE: Use a potato masher or a large fork to crush the apples manually until you reach the desired consistency.
7️⃣ FOR SMOOTH SAUCE: Transfer the mixture to a blender or use an immersion blender until it's completely silky and refined.
8️⃣ Serve warm for a cozy dessert, or let it cool and refrigerate for a refreshing skin-safe snack.
1️⃣ In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and Greek yogurt together until no white yogurt streaks remain. The yogurt provides the protein and the acidity needed for a good rise.
2️⃣ Stir in the cinnamon and baking powder. This allows the leavening agent to start working immediately with the yogurt's acidity.

3️⃣ Add the oat flour and stir until a thick batter forms. If the batter seems too dry (oat flour absorbs a lot of moisture), add the almond milk one tablespoon at a time until it's pourable but still thick.
4️⃣ Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Add a tiny amount of coconut oil and wipe out the excess with a paper towel for an even golden finish.
5️⃣ Use a 1/4 cup measure to pour the batter onto the skillet. Space them out so they don't touch.
6️⃣ IMPORTANT: Wait until you see bubbles form on the surface and the edges look dry and set. This usually takes 3–4 minutes on low heat.
7️⃣ Flip gently and cook for another 1–2 minutes on the other side until lightly browned.
8️⃣ Serve immediately. Instead of syrup, try topping with fresh berries or a dollop of almond butter for the ultimate clear-skin breakfast.

ingredients: 2 cups old fashioned rolled oats (gluten-free if needed)
1 cup roughly chopped raw almonds and walnuts
1/4 cup chia seeds or flax seeds
1/4 cup melted extra virgin coconut oil
a pinch of pink Himalayan salt
directions: 1️⃣ Preheat your oven to its lowest setting, about 300°F (150°C). Granola needs low and slow heat to get crunchy without burning the nuts.
2️⃣ In a very large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, chopped nuts, chia seeds, and spices. Toss well with a large spoon.
3️⃣ Pour the melted coconut oil and vanilla extract over the dry mixture. Use your hands or a spatula to ensure every single oat and nut is lightly coated in oil.
4️⃣ Spread the mixture out in a single, even layer on a large rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5️⃣ Bake for 25–30 minutes. Every 10 minutes, use a spatula to toss the granola from the edges toward the center to ensure even browning.
6️⃣ CRITICAL STEP: When the timer goes off, the granola might still feel slightly soft. This is normal! Do not overbake. It will crisp up significantly as it cools.
7️⃣ Remove from the oven and let it cool completely on the tray for at least 30 minutes without touching it. This ensures you get those large, crunchy clusters.
8️⃣ Once cool, break into clusters and store in an airtight glass jar. Enjoy with unsweetened almond milk or sprinkle over sugar-free coconut yogurt.

ingredients: 1/4 cup full-fat coconut milk (canned for richness)
a tiny pinch of sea salt (optional, brings out sweetness)
directions: 1️⃣ Prep your bananas at least 6 hours in advance. Peel very ripe bananas, slice them into 1-inch coins, and freeze them in a single layer in a freezer bag.
2️⃣ Take the frozen banana slices out of the freezer and let them sit at room temperature for about 3–5 minutes. This makes the blending process much easier.
3️⃣ Place the slightly thawed banana slices into a high-speed blender or a food processor.
4️⃣ Add the coconut milk and vanilla extract. The fat from the coconut milk is what gives it that professional 'gelato' texture.
5️⃣ Start blending on low speed, using a tamper if your blender has one to push the fruit down toward the blades.
6️⃣ Continue blending for about 45–60 seconds. You will see it transform from crumbly, to chunky, to suddenly a thick, creamy soft-serve consistency.
7️⃣ IMMEDIATELY serve in chilled bowls for a soft-serve experience.
8️⃣ For a scoopable texture, transfer the mixture to a container and freeze for another 45–60 minutes. Don't leave it longer or it will become too hard to scoop!
1️⃣ In a small glass pitcher, combine the warm water and the yeast. Stir once and let it sit for about 10 minutes until a thick foam forms on the surface. This 'blooming' proves your yeast is alive.
2️⃣ In a large wooden or glass mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour and salt. Create a 'well' (a hole) in the center of the flour.
3️⃣ Pour the yeast mixture and the olive oil into the well. Use a wooden spoon to slowly bring the flour from the edges into the center until a shaggy dough forms.

4️⃣ Dust a clean counter with a little flour. Turn the dough out and begin kneading. Push with the heel of your hand, fold, and turn. Do this for at least 10 minutes until the dough is smooth, elastic, and no longer sticks to your hands.
5️⃣ Lightly oil a bowl, place the dough inside, and cover with a damp warm towel. Let it rise in a draft-free spot for 60–90 minutes, or until it has doubled in size.
6️⃣ Gently punch the dough down to release air. Shape it into an oval loaf or place it in a greased loaf pan.
7️⃣ Cover again and let it rise for a second time for 45 minutes. This second rise is crucial for a light, airy loaf.
8️⃣ Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Use a sharp knife to make 3 parallel slashes across the top of the loaf to help it expand.
9️⃣ Bake for 30–35 minutes. When done, the loaf should sound hollow when tapped on the bottom.
🔟 Transfer to a wire rack. Wait at least 1 hour before slicing. Slicing too early lets the steam escape, which can lead to a gummy center.
